title: What does one of the greatest title rivalries in F1 history look like through the data?
text:
The 2021 Formula 1 season will undoubtedly go down as one of the best rivalry seasons of all time in any sport. Every race, every lap, every twist and turn of the season, Max Verstappen and Lewis Hamilton exchanged blows one way or another all the way up until the final race in Abu Dhabi where they both arrived on equal points. So, in a title fight that was tighter than any corner of the Monaco Street circuit, how did these two gladiators fare against each other throughout the season? Where did they gain on eachother? Where did they lose out? And how did these two manage to stay in another league completely compared to the rest of the grid?


Code
1 + 1


[1] 2

title: What Do F1 Teams Do When They Have No Previous Data?
text:
New tracks? Unpredictable conditions? In a sport driven by data, what do F1 teams do when they have no data from previous races to look at?


Code
1+1


[1] 2

title: About
text: ’Round and ’Round in circles… Tyler Diesing spends his days bringing the diverse and complex world of automotive and motorsport journalism to a broader audience in an understandable and entertaining format.
